alert.note: Alert for Upper Wind River Basin; Wind River Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 23 at 3:50PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Fremont County through 415 PM MDT... At 349 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Ethete, which is also 9 miles east of Fort Washakie, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Kinnear around 405 PM MDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Ocean Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Upper Wind River Basin; Wind River Basin
